definition: to stay young forever
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
surname Chun
forever/always/perpetual
to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)

sentences.english: Remain youth, happy good luck, happy peace and health, the spirit delectation.
sentences.chinese: 青春永駐，幸福吉祥，快樂安康，精神愉快。

sentences.english: She is the woman who found the secret to eternal youth.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個懂得如何保持青春永駐的女人。

sentences.english: Discover the mystery of Oil of Olay and discover younger looks at every age.
sentences.chinese: 探索玉蘭油的神奇，探索你青春永駐的奧祕。

sentences.english: Sincerely wish him eternal youth, art epistemic.
sentences.chinese: 衷心祝願他青春永駐，藝術嘗新。

sentences.english: It also means you'll remain young just as you got married.
sentences.chinese: 這個字還意味着你們永遠如新婚般青春永駐。

definition: smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
druggist
animals
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
superstructure
red in the face/extremely angry
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
